title: kejourou
body:
A yōkai from japanese folklore with [[very long hair]] or [[absurdly long hair]] that curtains her face and most of her body. The name translates to "Hairy Prostitute".

They appear in red-light districts and brothels. While they can sometimes have romantic relationships with humans (or other yōkai), more malicious ke-jōrō use their [[prehensile hair]] to attack humans that they want to eat.

For more information, refer here: http://yokai.com/?s=kejourou

title: zagato_(rayearth)
body:

[spoiler]In reality, Zagato was protecting Emeraude from the girls because he knew they were sent to kill her, and he deeply loved her.[/spoiler]

title: lantis_(rayearth)

He's reclusive at first glance but possesses as good heart, and [[Shidou Hikaru]] eventually falls in love with him. In the OVA, Lantis helps the girls and is accompanied by a black wolf Mashin that transforms into a sword.

title: lou_(phantasy_star)
body:
A character from the online multiplayer action role-playing game [i][[Phantasy Star Universe]][/i]. She also appears in [i][[Phantasy Star Portable 2]][/i] with an updated appearance.

She is a CAST, or [[android]], that functions as a member of the GUARDIANS Investigation Section, a group specializing in intelligence-related missions. For the sake of her special missions, she has been programmed not to exhibit excess emotion.

Lou is actually a mass produced CAST model that exists for a variety of purposes. There have been at least 905 individual models made, but the exact number is classified. Every Lou model is connected through thought and can relay information to any other model at anytime, barring interference.

title: amazons_quartet
body:
A group of four girls in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] who are bewitched by [[nehelenia (sailor moon)|Nehelenia]] to be part of the Dead Moon Circus in the anime. In the future, they will become the Sailor Quartet who will protect [[Chibi Usa]] as her guardians in the future, named after four of the largest asteroids in the solar system.

The images must contain at least one of the following characters to apply:

* [[cerecere (sailor moon)|Cerecere]] / [[Sailor Ceres]]
* [[junjun (sailor moon)|Junjun]] / [[Sailor Juno]]
* [[pallapalla (sailor moon)|Pallapalla]] / [[Sailor Pallas]]
* [[vesves (sailor moon)|Vesves]] / [[Sailor Vesta]]

title: zirconia_(sailor_moon)
body: Antagonist in the fourth arc of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]].

title: nehelenia_(sailor_moon)
body: The main antagonist of the fourth Sailor Moon arc, she is incredibly vain and seeks only to maintain her youth and beauty.

title: helios_(sailor_moon)
body: The real identity of [[pegasus (sailor moon)|Pegasus]] who hides in [[Chibi Usa]]'s Golden Mirror of Dreams. Helios is a priest of Elysion, where the Golden Kingdom was on Earth when Prince Endymion resided. He had to transform into Pegasus to hide from the Dead Moon Circus. It is heavily implied that Helios will be Chibi Usa's prince and marry her in the far future.

title: tiger_eye_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the Amazon Trio. He has blonde hair and wears a crop top and yellow pantyhose.

title: hawk_eye_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the Amazon Trio. Has short pink hair and wears a purple crop top.

title: kaolinite_(sailor_moon)
body: Antagonist in the third arc of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She has long red hair and pale skin.

title: rubeus_(sailor_moon)
body: The red-haired antagonist of the [[Black Moon Clan]], he uses the Ayakashi Sisters as pawns but winds up dying a pawn himself.

title: calaveras_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the [[Black Moon Clan]] members. She has short brown hair and wears yellow. She is renamed Avery in the English dub.

title: petz_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the [[Black Moon Clan]] members. She has green hair and mainly wears green and black. She is renamed Prizma in the English dub.

title: koan_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the [[Black Moon Clan]] members. Has long purple hair and wears a pink bodysuit. She is renamed Catzy in the English dub.

title: beruche_(sailor_moon)
body: One of the members of the [[Black Moon Clan]]. Has blue hair tied in a braid and wears a blue leotard. She is renamed Bertie in the English dub.

title: kunzite_(sailor_moon)
body: The final Shitennou introduced in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. He is [[zoisite (sailor moon)|Zoisite]]'s lover, and would have been [[Princess Venus]]' lover but was not used in the final version.

title: zoisite_(sailor_moon)
body: The third Shitennou introduced in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. He is [[kunzite (sailor moon)|Kunzite]]'s lover and was conceived to be [[Princess Mercury]]'s lover, but was never made in the final version. He was changed into a woman in the English dub.

title: nephrite_(sailor_moon)
body: The second Shittenou introduced in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. While ruthless against the [[Sailor Senshi]], he gains feelings for [[Oosaka Naru]], but is brutally killed by [[zoisite (sailor moon)|Zoisite]]. A conceived idea that was not finalized was that he would be [[Princess Jupiter]]'s lover.

title: jadeite_(sailor_moon)
body: The first Shittenou introduced in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], and the very first villain in the entire series that the [[Sailor Senshi]] must fight. A conceived idea that was never finalized was that he was [[Princess Mars]]' lover.

title: phobos_(sailor_moon)
body: One of [[Hino Rei]]'s crows, the other being [[deimos (sailor moon)|Deimos]].

title: deimos_(sailor_moon)
body: One of [[Hino Rei]]'s crows, the other being [[phobos (sailor moon)|Phobos]].

title: mimete_(sailor_moon)
body: The second member of the [[Witches 5]] to appear in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. Mimete was the most immature of the group, but excelled in charm-based magic and Daimon creation. Mimete is killed by [[tellu (sailor moon)|Tellu]] when she pulls the plug on an invention that warped Mimete into a television, "shutting her off" forever.

title: eudial_(sailor_moon)
body: The first member of the [[Witches 5]] to appear in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She uses technology and inventions to extract Heart Crystals, and she uses deadly flamethrowers for her final showdown against [[Sailor Moon]]. Eudial is killed by [[mimete (sailor moon)|Mimete]] sabotaging her car, forcing her to drive off a high cliff. Ironically, Mimete is killed by one of Eudial's inventions.

title: cyprine_(sailor_moon)
body: [[ptilol (sailor moon)|Ptilol]]'s twin sister who wears blue and her ponytail is on the right side. She is the fifth member of [[Witches 5]] to appear in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. Cyprine is often the one who appears in her civilian form, but when fighting, Ptilol will join her. They can absorb magical attacks to amplify their own while confusing their enemies with destructive spells. The twins are defeated when the [[Sailor Senshi]] trick them into attacking each other in episode 123.

title: viluy_(sailor_moon)
body: The fourth [[Witches 5]] member to appear in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She created a computer program to extract Heart Crystals from students during an exam, but [[Sailor Mercury]] caught up to her. Viluy uses nanomachines to try and kill her, but [[Super Sailor Moon]]'s attack manages to turn them against Viluy, breaking her apart.

title: tron_(sd_gundam)
body:
A character from "[[SD Command Chronicles]] (Command Senki) II: Gundam Force".
She's the vocalist (and only human) for the the band "Crushers", which is a secret ally of Gundam Force.
The band was called "Penalty Kick Oldies"  in one segment of 1993 film [i]SD Gundam Matsuri[/i].
Her character design was done by [[Kikuchi Michitaka]].

title: florina_(wild_arms)
body: A girl in [[Wild Arms 3]] who can sense that the planet Filgaia is dying. Florina tries to revive the planet by growing plants with special techniques. Is an expy of [[mariel (wild arms)|Mariel]] and [[Colette Mapleleaf]].

title: kressen_(wild_arms)
body: An antagonist in [[Wild Arms XF]]. Not much is known about him [spoiler]until Felius Arwin discovers that Kressen's spirit is within Weisheit, possible due to the power of an ARM. Both Felius and Kressen are from the Elw Dimension, but Kressen betrayed Felius and (through a series of mishaps) both ended up on Filgaia.[/spoiler]

title: weisheit_(wild_arms)
body: An antagonist in [[Wild Arms XF]] whose identity is almost a complete mystery. She is known as the Merchant of Death, and a 'Weisheit' has always been present throughout the Elesius Kingdom's history. Weisheit's tendency for androgyny is understandably confusing, but she enjoys it nonetheless. For Danbooru, Weisheit should be treated as female [spoiler]because she is really a male's spirit inside a female body - the spirit transfers to different bodies via an ARM. There is a separate tag for her original male counterpart, Kressen[/spoiler].

title: puka_(wild_arms)
body: [[Tim Rhymeless]]'s familiar who can change forms to facilitate the Guardians' summonings in [[Wild Arms 2]]. Named after a Celtic shapeshifting faery called a Púca.

title: ptolomea_(wild_arms)
body: One of the members of Coctyus in [[Wild Arms 2]], but turns out to be the least ruthless. Ptolomea is most concerned about the welfare of his troops, and even warns ARMS about his employer Vinsfeld being a madman. His name means 'traitor to guests'.

title: caina_(wild_arms)
body:
A sorcerer in [[Wild Arms 2]]'s Coctyus who wields the Magic Key Randolf to open portals to different dimensions. Caina is responsible for opening the gateway to where Lord Blazer was sealed, resulting in [[Ashley Winchester]]'s possession. Caina believes in Vinsfeld's ideals and follows him blindly. [spoiler]Of Odessa, Caina is the only one to survive past Disc 1, but is killed by Randolf.[/spoiler]

Due to localization issues, Caina was made female, but this is not considered canon. His name means 'traitor to blood relatives'.

title: belial_(wild_arms)
body: Scythe Riebaure's lover in [[Wild Arms 4]], Belial is a long-lived Crimson Noble who can control the fabric of space. She is not an official member of Brionac, but she fights [[Jude Maverick]]'s party after Scythe is killed.

title: asia_(wild_arms)
body: The green-haired twin doll given life by Heath, along with [[fiore (wild arms)|Fiore]]. They still function on dream energy long after Heath was executed. While their master was part of Brionac, the dolls are not considered official members. The twins confront [[Jude Maverick]]'s party and try to kidnap [[Yulie Ahtreide]], but are defeated.

title: fiore_(wild_arms)
body: The purple-haired twin doll given life by Heath, along with [[asia (wild_arms)|Asia]], in [[Wild Arms 4]]. They still function on dream energy long after Heath was executed. While their master was part of Brionac, the dolls are not considered official members. The twins confront [[Jude Maverick]]'s party and try to kidnap [[Yulie Ahtreide]], but are defeated.

body:

The symbol used on Japanese maps for [[onsen]]s, or hot springs.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: luceid_(wild_arms)
body:
The Guardian of Desire who makes several appearances in the [[Wild Arms]] franchise. Luceid's gender is not very specific at times - in the first game, Luceid is female, while in the second, Luceid is stated as male. His/her role also changes with each title, either being important to the story or just being a regular summon.

Of the Guardians, Luceid is the only one who can maintain physical form on Filgaia, often as a purple-furred wolf. Luceid is known to partner with people who have strong desires, such as [[Boomerang Flash]] and [[Anastasia Valeria]]. There is speculation that the white dog Tony in [[Wild Arms XF]] is Luceid, but there is no definite proof.

title: volsung_(wild_arms)
body: The main antagonist of [[Wild Arms 5]], Volsung is half-Human, half-Veruni, and was raised to believe he'd be the bridge for both races. However, he lost himself to hatred and pulled off a coup d'etat at the beginning of the game, leading the Radical faction to cleanse the world of Humans and Veruni alike.

title: elvis_(wild_arms)
body: One of the Four Sentinels in [[Wild Arms 5]], and the wisest. He is as physically strong as he is intelligent, and has earned high respect from the Veruni. Elvis adopted [[Carol Anderson]], and her journey involves proving to him that she can live independently.

title: atelier_annie
body: A side game in the [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series, starring a lazy girl who is 'kidnapped' and taken to an island, where she is motivated to develop her alchemy in order to marry a prince.

title: atelier_lise
body: A side game in the long-running [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series, starring a fledgling princess as she works to pay off her father's debt to the bank he borrowed money from.

title: atelier_lilie
body: The third game in the [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series and the last game of the Salburg trilogy.

title: atelier_elie
body: The second game in the [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series and likewise the second game in the Salburg trilogy.

title: kuukai
body:
'Kuukai (空海), also known posthumously as Koubou-Daishi (弘法大師 The Grand Master Who Propagated the Buddhist Teaching), 774–835, was a Japanese monk, civil servant, scholar, poet, and artist, founder of the Shingon or "True Word" school of Buddhism. Shingon followers usually refer to him by the honorific titles of O-Daishi-sama (お大師様) and Henjou-Kongou (遍照金剛).' [1]


h4. Links

* [1] "Wikipedia entry":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C5%ABkai

title: panzerfaust_(skullgirls)
body:
パンツァーファウスト

Panzerfaust was the greatest creation of ASG Lab 3's super soldier program. A veteran of the Grand War and boisterous patriot, he has continued his military duty and currently serves under [[Parasoul (skullgirls)|Parasoul]] and the [[Black Egrets]]. Sometimes reckless and foolhardy, he dives into battle and pushes the mechanisms of his body far beyond its alleged limits.

h4. See also:

title: caressing_testicles
body:
The act of stroking or stimulating the [[testicles]]. Often performed in conjunction with a [[handjob]] and/or [[fellatio]].

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Sex Acts]]

title: beatrix_(skullgirls)
body:
The fiercely competitive magician hoping to dethrone [[cerebella (skullgirls)|Cerebella]] and replace her both at the circus and as an agent of the Medicis. Beatrix wears the Cloak of Damocles, allowing her to carry and employ an impossible array of props - with some risk. She combines its genuinely supernatural properties with old fashioned sleight of hand for attacks nobody can see coming.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: mrs._victoria_(skullgirls)
body:
A strict but caring teacher at St. Theresa High School. When one of her students goes missing under violent circumstances, she takes it upon herself to investigate. Most would call such an act reckless, but she seems to know an awful lot about fighting, and old instincts die hard.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]
* [[D. Violet]]

title: adam_kapowski
body:
Adam is a Jack-of-all-trades elite soldier of the [[Black Egrets]]. Unfortunately, this does not help him stand out among the team. Being good with kids as well, he is also often tasked with babysitting [[umbrella (skullgirls)|Umbrella]]. Will he ever get the chance to prove himself to [[parasoul (skullgirls)|Princess Parasoul]]?

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: stanley_whitefin
body:
This Dagonian scientist prefers to fade into the background at work, not that he is always successful. Stanley originally helped develop weapons in the now defunct Lab 4, but following the surprise attack on Lab 8 it became clear the ASG needs all the (fish)manpower it can afford. He brings his previous inventions out of storage to fight alongside the soldiers, because the ASG Labs know better than to have a shark without a frickin’ laser beam...

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]
other_names: スタンレー・ホワイトフィン

title: regina_(skullgirls)
body:
The domineering beast tamer at the Cirque des Cartes, she commands a wide range of creatures including several outlandish specimens. She derives no pleasure from her cruelty, as it is simply in her cold nature to control others by any means necessary. The troupe ultimately answers to Regina, not the ringleader.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: roxie_(skullgirls)
body:
Originally a worker who assembled tanks and other vehicles during the Grand War, the [[Black Egrets]]' chief engineer always seems to have the right set of tools and parts on hand. A gearhead with a keen eye for machinery, she prefers to learn through the hands-on approach. Roxie loves to take apart and reassemble machines, striving to add custom improvements to their design. She is fascinated by the advanced technology created in the ASG labs, including [[panzerfaust (skullgirls)|Panzerfaust's]] arm.

h4. See also

* [[Parasoul (skullgirls)|Parasoul]]
* [[Molly (skullgirls)|Molly]]
* [[Skullgirls]]
* [[Rosie the Riveter]]

title: isaac_(skullgirls)
body:
Isaac is an archaeologist who has made unsettling discoveries below the Canopy Kingdom, only to have the evidence buried. Now hunted, Isaac has been literally buying time using shards of a unique type of Theonite he discovered in his search. The one other person who knows about the dig has been wrongfully imprisoned, but learning the truth would put her in greater danger.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: molly_(skullgirls)
body:
The [[Black Egrets]]' gung-ho communications officer. While her main job is keeping her team connected, [[Roxie (skullgirls)|Roxie]] has continually added features to her field telephone equipment and they are now classified as a weapons system. Though not the kind of information warfare Molly had in mind, she handles the array with her usual finesse and enthusiasm.

h4. See also

* [[parasoul (skullgirls)]]
* [[Skullgirls]]

title: ottomo_(skullgirls)
body:
The Medicis' outwardly refined mechanical henchman, piloted by the foul-mouthed Dagonian engineer Tom. Ottomo may appear comical, but he is nevertheless a lethal clutter of advanced weapons used to take care of family business.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: hive_(skullgirls)
body:
A flight-capable ASG Soldier implanted with the amorphous Synthetic Parasite, Beezle Bomb. A younger member, she can be brash and irritable at times but always has the team's best interests at heart. After all, they are the family she always wanted.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: d._violet
body:
A former crime fighter pulled into the web of intrigue woven around the latest Skullgirl. Deciding it was too much for her stuffy [[mrs. victoria_(skullgirls)|civilian identity]], she takes up her Living Weapon, the Pazuzu Whip, to don her alter ego once more.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: feng_(skullgirls)
body:
A Dragon Empire migrant showcasing her acrobatic skills at the Cirque des Cartes. The pair of birds perched on her head are an enigma, summoned by a lucky mistake in geomancy. As much as her family in Canopolis depends on her income, she worries what she and her friend [[cerebella (skullgirls)|Cerebella]] will be asked to do in the long run.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: leduc_(skullgirls)
body:
Leduc is a young ASG soldier who joined Lab 8 after the war. Having yet to learn the details of Lab 0's transgressions, his idealistic image of their organization will be challenged soon. The electricity his body channels is generated by his Synthetic Parasite, the Taranis Generator, which he can use to disable or destroy targets.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: ileum_(skullgirls)
body:
The mother figure of Lab 8, she was disfigured during the war before agreeing to be grafted with the Synthetic Parasite “Salamander Shell”. Able to squeeze through tight spaces, secrete acid, and wield drills, she is brilliant at infiltration and sabotage. However, the nature of her abilities makes them cruel to use on other human beings. She avoids confrontation when possible, but if pushed to fight she is the scariest member of her team

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: taliesin_(skullgirls)
body:
A bard who can play anything as a musical instrument. Taliesin’s role includes punishing members of the Cirque des Cartes who would defy their contract. He keeps a collection of his favorite victims, eliciting jealousy from his accomplice and Remote Parasite, [[muse (skullgirls)|Muse]]. Taliesin’s cursed touch stems from trading his hands for her arms.

h4. See also

* [[Skullgirls]]

title: venus_(skullgirls)
body:
Venus is the Trinity’s restless goddess of space, wielder of the otherworldly parasite, Abaddon. She grows tired of waiting for Mother’s plan and calls upon her unwilling foothold on the outside in a small act of rebellion. Her physical form is deceptive, as the true nature and size of Venus and Abaddon exist beyond the threshold of human comprehension.

h4. See also:

* [[aeon (skullgirls)|Aeon]]
* [[Skullgirls]]

title: samson_(skullgirls)
body:
A fanged parasitic being which lives on [[filia_(skullgirls)|Filia]]'s head, acting as [[prehensile hair]].

See also:

* [i][[Skullgirls]][/i]
* [[leviathan_(skullgirls)|Leviathan]] (parasite)
* [[vice-versa_(skullgirls)|Vice-Versa]] (living weapon [[hat]])
* [[futakuchi-onna]]

title: scythana
body:
Given the Gigans’ notorious reputation for being battle-hungry, berserker giants and their nation’s bloody history with the Canopy Kingdom, few were surprised when a criminal of [[gigan_(skullgirls)|Gigan]] blood attacked the Renoir Grand War Memorial. But while Scythana may have a record, she's no terrorist. With her [[isaac_(skullgirls)|employer]] refusing to tell her side of the story, she decided to regain her freedom by force.

h4. See also

* [[parasoul (skullgirls)|Parasoul]]
* [[Skullgirls]]

title: minky_momo
body:
The main heroine of [[Mahou no Princess Minky Momo]]. She is divided between two different Momos; Sora Momo who was in the 1982 series, and Umi Momo who was in the 1991 series. They share the same appearance (although Sora Momo has a star hairclip, while Umi Momo has a heart hairclip), and they both uphold a duty of returning hope and dreams to people.

In Sora Momo, Minky Momo is a girl from Fenarinarsa, "the land of dreams in the sky", who was sent to Earth to restore humanity's dwindling hopes and dreams. She becomes the daughter of a childless couple and uses her magic to help others. [spoiler]Momo is killed in a car accident and reborn as the childless couple's daughter.[/spoiler]

In Umi Momo, Minky Momo is from Marinasa, "the land of dreams in the bottom of the sea". She ascends to the ground to restore hopes and dreams, and is similarly adopted by a childless couple. [spoiler]Umi Momo meets Sora Momo, who encourages her to continue her duty even though her efforts are not working.[/spoiler]

body: The main heroine of the [[Spectral Force]] series, known as the Exploding Godhand (爆炎の申し子) due to her fire-related powers. She is a half-mazoku, born between a human mother and a mazoku overlord father, but she supports the mazoku side due to her distaste for humans - they were responsible for cutting off her left arm when she was a child, which was replaced with a mechanical claw. Hiro also wields the Gate of Heaven, a scythe that can reap souls.

title: des_x
body: Des X is a man made demon from the Disgaea series (specifically, Disgaea 4). She is a more perfected version of Desco. Her most prominent traits include: a large tail, pinkish horns on her head, pale yellow and blackish purple colored patterns on her dress, 'Usatako' monster on her back, and her most recognizable trait, many dark green eyes on her body and dress. Like her sister Desco, Des X believes herself as a final boss, and is always looking for ways to improve her skills or prove them to others. Unlike her sister, Des X is more cruel and violent, [spoiler] as in truth, she was the one who mercilessly killed Fuka, Descos other (human) sister in order to have Fukas father, who is also Desco and Des X's creator, all to herself. [/spoiler] As she is a more perfected version of desco, Des X has all the same skills as Desco (minus her final one) and all the same evilities (abilities) as her (except her initial one). Des X is only playable though DLC in disgaea 4, and cannot be obtained any other way.

title: helicopter_cat
body:
Orvillecopter (aka helicopter cat, catcopter) "is a remote-controlled quadcopter resembling a flying cat created by Dutch artist Bart Jansen." [1]  According to Jansen, the quadcopter was created using the taxidermied skin of his dead pet Orville, who was named after Orville Wright. 

The original YouTube video [2], uploaded in March 2012, has garnered millions of hits.

title: lambretta
body: A brand of [[scooter|scooters]] produced by the Italian company Innocenti. The main competitor to Vespa. Innocenti sold the Lambretta brand, designs and manufacturing equipment to the Indian government in 1972, which produced Lambretta scooters for sale in India till the late 90s. A new line of Lambretta scooters debuted in 2011, with bodies based on the classic Lambretta design made in Italy, and SYM engines and CVT transmissions from Taiwan.

title: miyamae_kanako
body:
The protagonist of [[Maria Holic]].

A tall, slender, well-endowed girl who, due to some form of allergy to men, had a traumatic incident with a boy at a young age. Now a lesbian, she transfers to a girls-only Catholic school in order to find her "fated one." However, she quickly learns that the girl she is most attracted to is actually a sadistic cross-dresser named [[Shidou Mariya]], who uses her lesbianism and his popularity to bend her to his will. 

She is somewhat perverted, frequently getting nosebleeds and excited by even a mere sight or suggestion of another girl's panties.

title: lml_star
body: The LML Star is either a 2 stroke or 4 stroke clone of the Vespa P Series, produced by Lohia Machinery Limited in India. LML produced scooters and parts under contract for Piaggio in the 80s and 90s, and after their contract ended, licensed versions sold under the LML brand. Imported in the US by Genuine Scooter Company and sold under the Stella name, stella being Italian for star.

title: clarice_di_lanza
body:
A playable character from the [[Arcana Heart]] series, introduced in [[Arcana Heart 2]] and reappearing in [[Arcana Heart 3]].

Clarice always has a composed personality and a smile on her face. She never fusses over trivial matters; she just enjoys the life she has. She used to be a noble from the Demon Realm. But she abandoned such a lavish life style and decided to live in the human world due to the influence of [[lilica felchenerow|Lilica]]'s father, Felchenerow. This still would not change the fact that she's a demon of pure blood. After learning of her existence, the Western European Spirit Sector sent [[Elsa la Conti|Elsa]] to fight her to the death. In order to save Elsa's life, Clarice imbued the power of the Arcana "Punishment" into her and took the power of the Arcana "Sin."
other_names: クラリーチェ・ディ・ランツァ

title: elsa_la_conti
body:
A playable character from the [[Arcana Heart]] series, introduced in [[Arcana Heart 2]] and reappearing in [[Arcana Heart 3]].

After losing her entire family in the hands of demons, Elsa enlisted in the Western Europe Spirit Sector. Elsa is usually mild-mannered, but she's also single-minded and airheaded at times. She is very straight forward and sometimes too strict on herself. She was once pitted in a fight to the death with [[Clarice di Lanza|Clarice]]. In the end, she and Clarice had their lives saved by the Arcanas Sin and Punishment, respectively, and are now close friends travelling the world as immortals.
other_names: エルザ・ラ・コンティ

title: electrolarynx
body:
An electrolarynx, sometimes referred to as a "throat back", is a medical device about the size of a small electric razor used to produce clearer speech by those who have lost their voicebox, usually due to cancer of the larynx. The most common device is a handheld, battery-operated device placed under the mandible which produces vibrations and allow speech.

title: vespa_p-series
body: The Vespa P Series of [[scooter|scooters]] was introduced in 1977 and production continues to today. The P Series is one of the most widely produced motor vehicles in history, manufactured not only by Piaggio in Italy, but also under license and contract by various manufacturers around the world, including India and Indonesia. Specific models include the P125X, P150X, P200E, PX125, PX150, PX200, and some clones or models based off of the P Series include the Bajaj Chetek and Legend, and the LML Star/Belladonna/Genuine Stella 2T and 4T. The P Series was the "Largeframe" models and its "Smallframe" counterpart is the Vespa PK. The P Series is the last all metal bodied, manual transmission "vintage" scooter produced by Vespa.

title: hatsuse_izuna
body:
初瀬いづな（はつせいづな、[i]Hatsuse Izuna[/i]）

A character in [[No Game No Life]].

A [i]Warbeast[/i] girl and the ambassador of the Warbeast race to Elchea.

Outwardly, she is an 8 years old girl who enjoys being petted, speaks using a lot of foul words without even realizing it, and ends every sentence with "desu" (translated as "please"). Inwardly, she possesses enormous physical abilities and has heightened senses of magic and psychological perception.

Izuna, like everyone else of her kind, has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]]. She has [[slit_pupils|slit-pupiled]] [[purple eyes]] and [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]] that is decorated with a [[hairband]]. The clothes she is wearing is that of [[japanese_clothes|Japanese clothes]]; [[wide_sleeves|wide-sleeved]] [[short kimono]], [[large bow]] over the obi, [[tabi]], and a pair of [[geta]].

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Hatsuse_Izuna
* MyAnimeList (EN): http://myanimelist.net/character/97767/Izuna_Hatsuse

title: stephanie_dora
body:
ステファニー・ドーラ（[i]Stephanie Dora[/i]）

A character in [[No Game No Life]].

The granddaughter of the former king of [i]Imanity[/i]. After the king's death, she aims to become the next queen of the country, only to then lose miserably to one [[Clammy Zell]].

While remarked as politically, academically, and socially adept, her naivety and incompetence at gaming in general has sometimes, if not always, put her in bad situations. And because of this, she becomes the series' butt monkey in no time at all.

Stephanie, who is occasionally also referred to as Steph, has [[blue eyes]], [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] that is decorated with a large [[hair_ornament|blue]] [[hair_flower|flower]]. Her clothes consist of [[dress]] that emphasizes her [[cleavage]], [[detached collar]] with [[bowtie]], and a pair of [[boots]].

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Stephanie_Dola
* MyAnimeList (EN): http://myanimelist.net/character/82527/Stephanie_Dora

title: sora_(no_game_no_life)
body:
空（そら、[i]Sora[/i]）

One of the main characters in [[No Game No Life]].

An 18 years old [[neet]], [[hikikomori|shut-in]] gamer along with his step-sister, [[shiro_(no_game_no_life)|Shiro]]. Despite being a shut-in, however, he has an extremely outgoing and confident personality. Together, they form『　　』（空白、くうはく、[i]kuuhaku[/i]; lit. blank space）

Sora is a [[skinny|tall and thin]] person, with [[spiked_hair|spiky]] [[black hair]] in the light novel and [[red_hair|maroon]] in the anime, also donning [[red_eyes|red]] [[tsurime|eyes]] with [[bags_under_eyes|dark bags]] under them. He also typically wears yellow [[t-shirt]] with [[clothes_writing|the text]] "I ♥ Humanity" written in Japanese on it.

h4.See also:
* Wikia (EN): http://no-game-no-life.wikia.com/wiki/Sora

body:
The main character of [[Mardock Scramble]], she is a 15-year-old girl with [[black hair]] and blue to grey-ish blue eyes.  The manga depiction has her with long [[hime cut]] hair, while the movie depiction has her with short hair.

Due to an injury she received, she is physically mute and communicates through electronic devices, such as by synthesizing her voice through a speaker or generating text on a screen.

The name Balot is derived from the word [[balut]].

title: kobayashi_mikoto
body:
A character in [[Reidol]].
She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]].


h4. Profile 
From http://www.cyc-soft.com/cyclet_pro/idol/character.html
[quote]五反田の秘書。

かつては村上とユニットを組んで歌手としてデビューしていた。
一時は恋仲になっていたが、
引退と同時に分かれている。

引退しようとしていた村上を
マネージャーとして事務所に
置いておくように社長に提言したのは彼女だが、かつての恋人のよしみなのかは不明。

まだ気があるようなふりをしながら性的な誘惑を何度も仕掛けてからかってくる。

五反田の意思を伝えるために
メッセンジャー的な役割も担っている。[/quote]

title: sakurai_yui
body:
A character in [[Reidol]].
She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]].


h4. Profile 
From http://www.cyc-soft.com/cyclet_pro/idol/character.html
[quote]清楚系アイドルとして
現在売出し中のアイドル。

だが、清楚な姿は仕事用で
実際は高飛車なところがあり、
下に見た人間に対しては
高圧的に接し、とことん蔑む。

もとは歌手を希望していたのだが、アイドルとして売り出されてしまった事に不満を持っている。

溜まっていた不満を爆発させ、
マネージャーである村上のミュージシャン時代をバカにする発言をしてしまい、激昂した村上にレイプされる結果を招いてしまう。

犯されたことにショックを受けて
いたが事務所はそんな彼女を
コネクション強化のための道具
にする事を決めてしまう。[/quote]

title: tsuki_tsuki!
body:
Tsuki Tsuki! (つきツキ！) is a light novel series written by Yujin Goto and illustrated by [[Korie Riko]], published in MF Bunko J. 

Synopsis : 

One day Shinobu wakes up just to find a naked blonde girl sleeping besides him. He has no memory whatsoever of her. Who is she? Why is she in his bed? Why is she naked? To make matters worse, his sister comes in and sees them. What will happen now?

title: moppy_(infinite_stratos)
body:
Moppy is a parody character of [[Shinonono Houki]] from [i][[Infinite Stratos]][/i]. She is a [[Chibi]] character, naked at all times, who always makes sarcastic comments.

The following is a quotation from "EvaGeeks.org Forum":http://forum.evageeks.org/post/505786/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magika/#505722.

[i]10. モッピー　Moppy　
An omnipresent little character who is a clear parody of Houki Shinonono 篠ノ之 箒 from Infinite Stratos. Moppy originated in 2ch sales thread, and was based on the character Houki Shinonono. Without any base in the anime, this Houki parody came out to mock and laugh at other anime for selling poorer than I.S. (or as likely, going to sell poorer than I.S.) or just laugh at this and that (like sales trend or related manga/novel sales), but when she was proven wrong, then she would smilingly declared that she knew all along the other anime will do well or that she is in fact a fan all along. Now its use is so ubiquitous that you see her in book stores, game centers, video rental stores etc to make sales speech over this or that. She likes to use the words "Moppy always know..." モッピー知ってるよ The name Moppy came from the name Houki because in Japanese Houki means Broom, which will be Mop in its modern incarnation.[/i]

h4.See also

* Nicopedia article (JPN): http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/モッピー
* "Google Image Search":https://www.google.com/images?hl=en&source=hp&q="インフィニット・ストラトス"|"IS"+モッピー&gbv=2&aq=f&oq=&aqi=&biw=1920&bih=916&sei=FeCoUJPmA-mBiQe2wIGgDA

title: aquarion_evol
body:
アクエリオンEVOL 

A winter 2012 anime produced by Satelight and [[Kawamori Shouji]] and sequel to [i][[Sousei no Aquarion]][/i], set 12,000 years after the end of the first series. 

The show details humanity's new struggle against the Abductors from a mysterious realm using the Aquarion, a mecha formed from three vehicles operated by members of Neo DEAVA, a training institution for psychically-endowed teens. Among its newest members are [[Amata Sora]], a boy with a mysterious power of levitation, and [[Mikono Suzushiro]], a girl he saves from an Abductor attack.

The secondary team of [[Sailor Senshi]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], consisting of four powerful heroines named after the outermost planets furthest away from the Sun. The image should contain two or more of the following characters: [[Sailor Uranus]], [[Sailor Neptune]], [[Sailor Pluto]] and [[Sailor Saturn]]. [[Sailor Moon]] and [[Sailor Chibi Moon]] can be present as well. If the [[Inner Senshi]] are also present, just use the [[Sailor Senshi]] tag. Also applies to parodies and crossovers.

title: abarakasen
body:
A severely emaciated version of [[Ibaraki Kasen]], skinny to the point of her ribs being visible under her skin. 

Its origin lies in the entry from [i]Perfect Memento in Strict Sense[/i] about hermits, which describes them as usually eating only a few fruits and nuts, and being capable of not eating at all once they turn 500 years old. The name [i]Abarakasen[/i] (肋華仙) is itself a pun between Kasen's nickname [i]Ibarakasen[/i] (茨華仙) and [i]abara[/i], the Japanese word for "rib"; in English it would be something like "Ribarakasen". 

h4.See also 

* http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kasen_Ibaraki#Fanon
* http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Perfect_Memento_in_Strict_Sense/Hermits

title: gateball
body:
"Gateball is a mallet team sport similar to croquet. It is a fast-paced, non-contact, highly-strategic team game, which can be played by anyone regardless of age or gender. 

"Gateball is played on a rectangular court 20–25 metres long and 15–20 metres wide. Each court has three gates and a goal pole. The game is played by two teams (red and white) of up to five players. Each player has a numbered ball corresponding to their playing order. The odd-numbered balls are red and the even-numbered balls are white. Teams score one point for each ball hit through a gate and two points for hitting the goal pole, in accordance with the rules. A game of gateball lasts for thirty minutes and the winner is the team with the most points at the end of the game." [1] 

h4. See also 

* [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gateball

title: izuna_(shinrabanshou)
body:
イヅナ

A character in [[Shinrabanshou]]. Izuna is a [[kyuubi]] fox spirit introduced in the 2010 storyline Zex Factor as the "beast soul" partner of the main character, [[Homura Kai]]. She reappears in a weakened form in following year's story, Shichiten no Hasha, as the mother of the new main character, [[sai_(shinrabanshou)|Sai]].

Izuna wears a [[miko]] dress and has two forms: her initial beast soul form, with a small [[chibi]]-like body and gray hair, and her true form, with an adult body and blonde hair. After she regains her true form, her beast soul body also features blonde hair.

h4. Cards:

* ZX PR: "Hagure Spirits Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/zexfacter1/ZXPR.html (はぐれ魂獣イヅナ, partner form)
* ZX PR: "Hagure Spirits Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/zexfacter1/ZXPRa.html (blonde version)
* ZX 094: "Hakumenkongoukyuubi Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/zexfacter4/ZX094.html (白面金剛九尾イヅナ, true form)
* ZX EP: "Kai & Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/zexfacter4/ZXEP.html (カイ＆イヅナ)
* Shichiten 002: "Hakumengozen Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/shichiten1/Shichiten002.html (白面御前イヅナ, weakened form)
* Shichiten EX09: "Hakumenkongoukyuubi Izuna":http://www.palusuke.com/list/shichiten3/ShichitenEX09.html (白面金剛九尾イヅナ, true form)

title: jamadhar
body:
Jamadhar is a weapon of Indian origin, looking somewhat like a mixture of brass knuckles and a dagger.

Also known as katar or katara. "Japanese Wikipedia article on jamadhar":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ジャマダハル states that "the western naming convention of Indian "push daggers":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Push_dagger as katar, kutar or katara is actually a misapplication of the word, as katar properly refered to a type of double-edged short sword. This misinterpretation arose from the illustrations of the katar and jamadhar being reversed in "'Ain-i-Akbari'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ain-i-Akbari a 16th century historical account authored by "Abu'l-Fazl,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abu%27l-Fazl_ibn_Mubarak who served Emperor Akbar of the Mughal Empire." 

Famously worn by the Assassin class in [[Ragnarok Online]] and [[Diablo 2]], and by [[Voldo]] in the [[Soulcalibur]] series (who [[dual wielding|dual wields]] a triple-bladed variant).

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia on katar":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katara_%28dagger%29

title: locadol_promotion
body:
The [i]2.5 Dimension TV: Locadol Promotion Illustration Contest[/i] was run on Pixiv in 2013 from June 13 to July 31.

h4. Contest details

Participants were to create "an original 'local idol' character with a reference to a local area, such as clothing, accessories, songs, and dances." [1] Participants were then to tag their post with their prefecture or, for locations outside of Japan, their country (ex. USA). 


h4. Contest results

The contest results were announced "here":http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion_announce/.

* Six First-place winners won 50,000 yen
** West
*** [[Okinawa]] || [[amksr417]] || post #1640385
*** Nara || [[teru (grafroller)]] || post #1640387
*** [[Hiroshima]] || [[kurubu]] || post #1640389
** East
*** [[Hokkaido]] || [[shirotsuna]] || post #1640391
*** [[Kanagawa]] || [[yurikuta tsukumi]] || post #1640398
*** Saitama || [[naako0023]] || post #1640403

* Up to 47 second-place winners won 25,000 yen  (following list is not comprehensive)
** Touhoku
*** [[aomori_prefecture|Aomori]] || [[yokiri]] || post #1530875
** Kantou
*** Tokyo || [[ochau]] || post #1475806
** Chuubu
*** Niigata || [[yokiri]] || post #1530874


h4. See Also

* http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion.php
* [1] "Contest terms and conditions":http://www.pixiv.net/contest/locadolpromotion_terms.php
* "Post describing contest":http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=36352511

title: lupin_dive

title: omoide_no_ie
body:
思い出の家 (House of Memories)

Created by [[sumiobunnya]] (aka masurao). 
[i]Omoide no Ie[/i] was a series of "YJP":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/ゆっくり実況プレイ movies using [i][[the sims|The Sims 2]][/i]. However, sumiobunnya has stopped making these movies and is instead planning on redoing the series as a manga. Additionally, he has made all the previous movies private due to copyright concerns. See the blog post "here":http://shimekirigakuru.blogspot.com/2013/06/blog-post.html.

title: orita_hikoichi_(statue)
body:
折田先生像 (Orita Sensei's Statue / Mr. Orita Statue) 

Orita Hikoichi (折田彦市, 1849-1920) was  an educationalist active in "Meiji period":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meiji_period Japan and and the first principal of the 3rd Higher School, one of predecessors of "Kyoto University.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyoto_University 
The motto of the university, "academic freedom" is based on his philosophy. 

His statue was settled  in front of the building of the Faculty of Liberal Arts (now the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies)  of the University in the 50's. 

Since around 80's, Mr. Orita was painted, defaced and the statue "[[cosplay]]ed" as random characters when the university has an event like the entrance exam. 
In 1994 the college started posting signs saying: 
[quote]折田彦市先生は、第三高等学校の校長として京大の創設に尽力し、京大に自由の学風を築くために多大な功績を残した人です。 どうかこの像を汚さないで下さい。 

総合人間学 
[/quote] 
[quote] 
As a school principal of the 3rd Higher School, Mr.Orita Hikoichi assisted in the founding of Kyoto University, and is a person who has left behind many achievements in pursuit of academic freedom at the University. Please do not mess up the statue. 

Faculty of Integrated Human Studies 
[/quote] 
Since then,  when Mr. Orita was painted, its parody text  was posted by this statue. 

In 1997, the statue finally left the campus basement. Immediately after that, however, a fake statue was set up where the real one stood. Since 2002, Mr. Orita's fake statues appeared in front of the Library of the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies almost every year around entrance exam season. 

The college once commented favorably to these acts "on their official webpage":http://web.archive.org/web/20080303042003/http://www.z.k.kyoto-u.ac.jp/news.cgi?type=information&row_id=2192 in 2008. 

h4.External links 

* "Japanese fanpage of Orita-sensei and his statue":http://sites.google.com/site/freedomorita/
* "Wikipedia article(JP): Orita Hikoichi":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8A%98%E7%94%B0%E5%BD%A6%E5%B8%82
* "Wikipedia article(JP): Mr. Orita Statue":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8A%98%E7%94%B0%E5%85%88%E7%94%9F%E5%83%8F
* "'Takeshi statue welcomes Kyoto University test-takers' from BulbaNews, 2010":http://bulbanews.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Takeshi_statue_welcomes_Kyoto_University_test-takers 
* "'Orita Sensei of Kyoto University' from 'watashi to tokyo'":http://smt.blogs.com/mari_diary/2005/10/orita_sensei_of.html

title: odin_(seikai_seifuku)
body:

[spoiler]He later defects to the governor of Tokyo, but is accepted back (after some time not getting dinner as a penance) after the governor is defeated by Zvezda.[/spoiler]

Etymology: Odin/Один is Russian for "one".

title: professor_um
body:
Alter ego of [[natasha_(sekai_seifuku)|Natasha resp. Natalia Vasylchenko]], the member of the inner circle of Zvezda. She is the main technology expert of Zvezda and also responsible for the maintenance of their superweapons and the HQ.

[spoiler]She was separated from her parents by unknown beings she called "fairies" and rescued by Kate. Her parents seem to have a connection to whatever force stood behind the governor of Tokyo, Kyoushirou Jimon.[/spoiler]

Etymology: Um/Ум is Russian for "mind".

title: sayakaba
body:
[[Animalization]] of [[Miki Sayaka]] as a hippopotamus.

This is derived from a pun. One of Sayaka's famous lines from [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i] is:

* あたしって、ほんと[b]バカ[/b] ([[I'm such a fool]])

If you flip the characters in バカ (baka, meaning idiot/fool), you get:

* あたしって、ほんと[b]カバ[/b] (I really am a hippo)


h4. See also

* [[Gomadoka]], an animalization of [[Kaname Madoka]] as a seal.
* [[Homurakko]], an animalization of [[Akemi Homura]] as a sea otter.
* [[Mamikurage]], an animalization of [[Tomoe Mami]] as a jellyfish.

title: taihou_to_stamp
body:
大砲とスタンプ (Taihou to Stamp, lit. Guns and Stamps)

Manga series by [[Hayami Rasenjin]], serialized in Koudansha's "Gekkan Morning Two.":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%88%E5%88%8A%E3%83%A2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%8B%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B0two 

The story is set in an alternate world with 20th century-like technology, during a great war between the alliance of the Grand Duchy (Russia that never formed) and the Empire (Poland-Lithuania that never fell into ruin) on one side, and the Republic (the Ottoman Empire that never fell apart) on the other.

Lieutenant Martina M. Mayakovskaya is a new officer in the Grand Duchy Logistics Corps. It's a branch of the armed forces responsible for transportation and supply that is looked down upon by the rest of the military as "paper soldiers". Martina's assignment is supposed to be a comfortable desk job dealing with stamping paperwork, but for some reason wherever she goes, she ends up in the middle of combat. Also, what's that [[stamp_(taihou_to_stamp)|eight-legged pseudoweasel]] that she adopted as a pet (or it adopted her?), and is it just a coincidence that it seems to be saving her from harm every time?

h4.Characters

* [[Martina M Mayakovskaya]]

title: too_many_frills
body:
Known as Frill Jigoku (フリル地獄, literally, "Frill Hell") on Pixiv. This tag is for images with unholy emphasis on frills.

Here's some good qualifications for entry:

* Ungodly amounts of frills.
* Multiple layers of frills in the same general area, especially on large skirts.
* Frills over multiple portions of an outfit. Frilled skirts are common and almost required, so having frills on gloves, thighhighs, hats, sleeves, shoes, pacemakers, etc. helps.
* Inventive or uncommon use of frills.
* Frills take up a noticable chunk of an image. It's hard to place a number on this one, but if frills take up half the image then that post is almost assuredly qualified. A more realistic expectation would be somewhere along 15%.

For characters that usually wear a lot of frills, the bar should be a little bit higher than normal.

In short, there are just too many frills.

h4. See Also

* [[too many]]

title: uriko-hime_to_amanojaku
body:
瓜子姫 (うりこひめ / [i][[Uriko-hime]][/i], literally, "melon princess"), or alternatively, うりこひめとあまのじゃく (Uriko-hime and an Amanojaku) is a Japanese fairy tale. Among the folktales in which the short, demon-like humanoid called [[amanojaku_(creature)|Amanojaku]] appears, this story is the only type which is widely recounted throughout Japan.

In a basic summary of the story, a baby born from a melon is carefully raised by an old couple, and she grows up to be a beautiful young woman skilled at weaving. While her adoptive parents are away from their home, Amanojaku tricks and kidnaps her. The demon impersonates Uriko-hime, but while the impostor is going to a wealthy man's home to marry him, the fake Uriko-hime is accused by the cawing of a crow, and reveals her true identity, whereupon his true form is revealed, and the old couple and accompanying villagers beat him to death (or alternatively, he runs away).

This folktale is known for the countless variations on the story depending on the region. In southwestern Japan, her clothes are stolen and she is tied up to a tree, but in many cases she escapes unharmed and lives happily in the end. In northwestern Japan, in many versions the poor young woman is tricked to climb a persimmon tree from which she falls to her death. Amanojaku flays her skin and impersonates her by wearing it.

At the end of the tale, it is often accompanied by an explanation that the place where Amanojaku was killed was a field of buckwheat, and that is why buckwheat stalks are red.

title: asame_shinbun
body:
朝目新聞([i]Asame Shinbun[/i], Asame News) is a famous Japanese website centered around picture [[parody|parodies]] of manga and game characters. The website's name is a parody of "Asahi Shinbun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asahi_Shimbun , and the webmaster is "机器猫 (Ji qi mao)." (His name is based on [[doraemon_(character)|Doraemon]]'s name in Chinese, but he is Japanese.)

The many images posted on the website's six [[oekaki]]/image boards are archived by genre on the place called "Asame Graph." Also, other interesting links and related articles are listed across the top page of the website.

The website has a long history, and among the posters on the imageboards, there are people who became professional artists. 

h4.See Also

* Asame Shinbun: http://www.ne.jp/asahi/asame/shinbun/
* Asame Graph: http://asame.sakura.ne.jp/graph/bbsgal.html
* 机器猫's Twitter account: http://twitter.com/asamenews

title: ginoza_nobuchika
body:
[b]宜野座 伸元 (ぎのざ のぶちか)[/b]

A character from [[Psycho-Pass]],the lead Inspector of Unit One of the Public Safety Bureau's Criminal Investigation Division. Ginoza holds an extreme distrust of Latent Criminals and is a serious man who appears to have based most of his life on his job as an Inspector. Despite his disposition he is actually on relatively good terms with his Enforcers. He shows concern for his subordinate [[Tsunemori Akane]] and warns her about the possibility of an Inspector becoming a latent criminal using [[Kougami Shin'ya]] as an example. Frequently called "Gino" by Kougami. It is revealed that [spoiler][[Tomomi Masaoka]] is his father, and he harbors resentment towards him for having become a criminal and leaving him and his mother in a difficult situation. He slightly reconciles with him afterwards. In episode 21, Nobuchika's left arm is crushed by a trap set by [[Makishima Shougo]].[/spoiler]

body:
Gungriffon is a [[mecha]]-themed FPS video game developed by Game Arts for the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1996. The game has three sequels: "Gungriffon II", "Blaze" and "Allied Strike"

Its English version has a bit different story from the Japanese version of it. The original story takes place in 2015 and the player is a HIGH-MACS pilot of the APC (Asian Pacific Community)'s Foreign Legion. In the English version, the player is a member of the UAC (United America Countries) in 2074.

title: hamburger_steak
body:
A [i]Hamburger Steak[/i] is a dish which consists of ground meat clumped together in a round shape and cooked. Unlike a meatloaf, neither a mold nor oven are used, and it is mainly cooked on a frying pan.
Although it is known by several names, such as “hamburger patty” or “salisbury steak”, in Japan it is called either “ハンバーグ (hamburg)” or “ハンバーグステーキ (hamburg steak).” Moreover, just like its name, this dish's ingredients and seasonings all vary slightly.
In Japan, it is extremely popular among children, and is a standard part of the menu in school lunches and family restaurants. 

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: harken_browning
body:
The protagonist of [[super_robot_wars_og_saga_mugen_no_frontier|Super Robot Taisen - OG Saga: Endless Frontier]]. He is voiced by [[Hiyama Nobuyuki]]. Wields a [[bayonet]]-equipped [[assault rifle]] with an underslung [[pile bunker]] called the "Night Fowl" and a long-barreled [[revolver]] called the "Longtomb Special".

A bounty hunter who, along with his bodyguard / assistant / foil [[Aschen Brodel]] journey the Endless Frontier in search of adventure.

[spoiler]Is actually W-00, the first prototype of the W-Series which spawned both Aschen (W-07) and her younger "sister" [[Lamia Loveless]] (W-17); a genetically synthesized human created by, and based on the DNA of, [[Lemon Browning]].[/spoiler]

Finding this out doesn't actually cause him to angst about it too much, though; he even turns it into a boob joke referencing [[Nanbu_Kaguya|Kaguya]]'s [[large breasts]] ("It's not like that lovely bunch of coconuts is just gonna disappear some day.").

body:
[b]Karigurashi no Arrietty[/b] (lit. [i]The Borrower Arrietty[/i]), titled [b]The Secret World of Arrietty[/b] in North America, is a 2010 Japanese animated fantasy film directed by Yonebayashi Hiromasa and scripted by Miyazaki Hayao and Niwa Keiko. It is based on "[i]The Borrowers[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Borrowers by Mary Norton, an English author of children's books, about a family of tiny people who live secretly in the walls and floors of a typical household, borrowing items from humans to survive.

h4. See also

* [[Miyazaki Hayao (person)]]
* [[Studio Ghibli]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website (JP)":http://www.karigurashi.jp/index.html
* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arrietty
